content:
A city break sounds like a blast! You're already a pro at packing lightly, so I'll just remind you of some essentials to double-check:

**Clothing:**

* 2-3 tops or blouses that can be layered (t-shirts, blouses, or sweaters)
* 2-3 bottoms (jeans, trousers, or a skirt) that can be mixed and matched with the tops
* 1 lightweight jacket or coat (depending on the weather)
* Undergarments and socks
* Comfortable walking shoes or sneakers
* Dress shoes or nicer footwear if you plan to visit fancier restaurants or attractions
* A scarf or hat for added style and layering

**Toiletries:**

* Toothbrush, toothpaste, and dental floss
* Deodorant, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash
* Razor and shaving cream (if applicable)
* Makeup and makeup remover (if applicable)
* Hairbrush or comb
* Contact lenses and solution (if applicable)
* Prescription medication and any necessary documents

**Electronics:**

* Phone and charger
* Laptop and charger (if necessary)
* Camera and charger (if you plan on taking a lot of photos)
* Portable charger (a good idea for long days of sightseeing)
* Headphones or earbuds

**Miscellaneous:**

* Wallet and/or travel purse
* Travel documents (passport, ID, travel itinerary)
* Snacks (especially if you have specific dietary needs or preferences)
* Reusable water bottle
* Umbrella or raincoat (if rain is forecasted)
* Travel-size essentials like eye mask, earplugs, and pain relievers

**City-specific items:**

* A map or guidebook of the city
* A list of recommended restaurants and attractions
* A small backpack or cross-body bag for carrying essentials during the day

Remember to check the weather forecast before your trip and adjust your packing list accordingly. You can also consider packing a portable laundry detergent or pre-moistened laundry wipes in case you need to wash any clothing items during your trip.

Since you're a pro at packing lightly, I'm sure you'll fit everything into your carry-on bag with ease! Have a fantastic trip!
